body_html: @apaszke because cudnn doesn't have support for deterministic dilated gradient w.r.t. data, the dilated conv can't be truly deterministic. So like you suggested, we can have a fallback but I think we should also throw some message that user passed invalid arguments (i.e dilation > 1 and deterministic=True) ow they will wonder why their dilated conv is not giving deterministic result. In short, I think we should have a fallback and throw some warning to say something about this.

body: @apaszke because cudnn doesn't have support for deterministic dilated gradient w.r.t. data, the dilated conv can't be truly deterministic. So like you suggested, we can have a fallback but I think we should also throw some message that user passed invalid arguments (i.e dilation > 1 and deterministic=True) ow they will wonder why their dilated conv is not giving deterministic result. In short, I think we should have a fallback and throw some warning to say something about this.
